channel.title: How do I package a source?
channel.description:
I was wondering how would I package a source? So basically the .class/.java files will be in a separate folder not in one huge folder with everything in it. I also want to know how would I also do that with a client
Thanks, Crn

item.title: How do I package a source?
item.dc:creator: @Crn Crn_
item.description:
@Crn wrote:

I know but that example wasn’t that wellas it isn’t that descriptive and doesn’t show me how to actually do it =/
`Rich could you tell me how as I know you know how to since you did it with your latest release of Richscape.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I package a source?
item.dc:creator: @Crn Crn_
item.description:
@Crn wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:6, topic:251622”][quote author=Crn_ link=topic=332174.msg2592020#msg2592020 date=1229819654]

You get a box and some tape, then you put your computer in it and close box and wrap it with tape and your done… while you finished that you can open your window and toss the shit out

Get a fucking life. He needs help, not spam.

I mean a 317 source how would I package it as I don’t see anything you are referring to?
[/quote]

Theres no difference between 317 and 508 packaging, It’s all the same.[/quote]
I don’t have these files.
rs2 > player > games > Java file

Read full topic

item.source: How do I package a source?

item.title: How do I package a source?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Crn_, post:1, topic:251622”]I was wondering how would I package a source? So basically the .class/.java files will be in a separate folder not in one huge folder with everything in it. I also want to know how would I also do that with a client

Thanks,
Crn[/quote]

Example:

package rs2.player.games;

The directory for that, will be:

[Server files > (Subfolder (Any name)) > rs2 > player > games > Java file]

Read full topic
